text: Peter Agre (born January 30, 1949) is an American physician and molecular biologist. He was a professor at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and Johns Hopkins School of Medicine. In 2003, Agre and Roderick MacKinnon shared the 2003 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for "discoveries concerning ion channels in cell membranes." A In 2009, Agre was elected president of the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS) and became active in science diplomacy. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:American physicians Category:American biologists Category:Scientists from Minnesota
title: Peter Agre
